p: DNA vaccines, chimeric viral vaccines, and membrane vesicle-vaccines are valuable options [ 201]. An mRNA-based vaccine by Moderna ® is believed to develop antibodies against spike proteins of SARS-CoV-2, and a batch of vaccine has been delivered to the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases. That was developed 42 days after the DNA sequence of SARS-CoV-2 was disclosed. Eli Lilly ® and AbCellera ® are evaluating Antibody-based treatment. GlaxoSmithKline ® has produced a pandemic vaccine adjuvant platform that it is partnering with other institutes and companies for use in COVID-19 vaccine candidates. Concerning this, recombinant DNA vaccines using GSK’s adjuvant are being developed by Sanofi ® in collaboration with GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) and expected to start phase 1/2 clinical study in September 2020 [ 222, 223].
